Job Description: A successful candidate must have a strong understanding of distributed systems and demonstrate the ability to effectively test and troubleshoot them. You ll need to understand software internals, debug code, automate repetitive tasks, and implement new tools and frameworks needed to streamline and automate our validation processes.          Key Technologies    Go    Kubernetes    AWS, Azure, and GCP    Couchbase Server    In this role you can expect to:    Write a lot code using the Go (Golang) programming language    Write more Go while you build and maintain reliable test automation that validates correctness and scalability of software    Define, plan, and execute test cases for distributed systemsCollaborate with product and engineering teams to define specifications and develop test plans    Adopt, improve, and advocate for our vision for the quality of Couchbase Cloud products    Make it easy for engineers to contribute and enhance tests    Collaborate with engineering teams to find effective solutions to testing challenges    Collaborate with engineering teams to reproduce complex scenarios discovered in our own testing or reported by customers and write regression tests to fix and prevent them    Write and review technical proposals    Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes    You may be a good fit for our team if:    You are kind and collaborative    You enjoy working remote with people from all over the world    The software you write is sympathetic to the humans who will maintain it    You care deeply about software quality and operability, and better ways of building softwareValue clear, open communication. We value thoughtful feedback and regular dialogue and collaboration as a fundamental skill for our team members    You are comfortable with Go or another low-level programming language and would like to write write Go    You have experience automating infrastructure using tools such as Terraform or Cloud SDKs    Demonstrate excellent time management skills and the ability to make realistic assessments of product complexity    What does success in this role look like    In three months, you ll have made a material impact by validating the correctness of software through the introduction and enhancement of reliable tests and are effectively collaborating on the design of new features and their specifications    In six months, you have established a cadence of predictable, on-time delivery without cutting corners    In twelve months, you have earned the trust of the team and are delivering tasks through the entire SDLC, from design through development with minimal guidance and have established yourself as the go-to person for the behavior of several parts of the system    Responsibilities    Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software    Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables    Work with product and engineering teams to design and develop test plans for Couchbase Cloud products    Adopt, improve, and advocate for our vision for the quality of Couchbase Cloud products
